meanings.sent1: I used a special tool to demulsify the mixture into its individual components.
meanings.sent2: The scientist needed to demulsify the solution to analyze each part separately.
meanings.sent3: Trying to demulsify the tangled mess of wires was like solving a complex puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to demulsify complex ideas into simple concepts made her an excellent teacher.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes seemed to demulsify the colors, creating a beautiful blend on the canvas.

meanings.definition: To break down into smaller components
meanings.sent1: The enzyme helped demulsify the food into nutrients that could be easily absorbed.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the rain will demulsify the rock into smaller pieces.
meanings.sent3: Watching the demolition crew demulsify the old building was strangely satisfying.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat seemed to demulsify the ice, turning it into a refreshing drink.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's explanations were so clear that they seemed to demulsify the complex topic into understandable bits.
